Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

MITRE’s newly established Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomy Innovation Center consists of a multi-generational, diverse team united by a passion and a sense of urgency to harness AI and Autonomy to help solve problems in the public interest. We discover, create, and lead through empowering an inclusive community of collaborative innovators, learners, and technical creatives. We are looking for people with a lifelong commitment to learning, who are passionate about harnessing artificial intelligence to make a positive impact in the world. We have built a supportive and inclusive environment where collaboration is encouraged and learning is shared freely. We value our diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds, and perspectives and harness these qualities to discover connections, solve problems, and create extraordinary impact.

Key Description: Join us for a paid internship that offers the opportunity to learn how to harness AI to address challenges that range from global health to national security. As part of our internship program Research Interns will not be cloistered in the lab, but instead you can expect to work closely with government and organizations in the public sector to invent and build AI-enabled solutions to some of the most challenging problems facing society. Ideas may come from MITRE’s internal research program as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the country. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new AI architectures, Research Interns work on challenges in artificial intelligence, machine learning, computer vision, and natural language processing to discover creative ways in which AI can have a positive impact on the security, health, vitality, and safety of the world around us.

*A pplying to this pipeline requisition will put you in a candidate pool that will be viewed and considered by our AI & Autonomy Innovation Center's technical leaders, all hiring for the same role across our departments.

Required Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Natural Sciences or a related technical field.

  • Sustained excellence in academic performance.

  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including: C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python or similar.

  • Ability to obtain/maintain a US Clearance (U.S. Citizenship required). Security clearance or Suitability level may be required and may vary; applicants will be updated during interview process. (Because a full-time position requires a US government security clearance, we require our interns to be clearable even though they may not need a security clearance or suitability determination during their internship.).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in one or more areas of computer science, such as Natural Language Understanding, Neural Networks, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Privacy, Trust & Safety, Software Engineering or similar.

  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including: C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python or similar.

  • Applied experience working within technical fields ranging anywhere from technical health to national security.

  • Preference given to qualified candidates with active US government security clearance.

Allogene Therapeutics, with headquarters in South San Francisco, is a clinical-stage biotechnology company pioneering the development of allogeneic chimeric antigen receptor T cell (AlloCAR T™) therapies for cancer. Led by a management team with significant experience in cell therapy, Allogene is developing a pipeline of “off-the-shelf” CAR T cell therapy candidates with the goal of delivering readily available cell therapy on-demand, more reliably, and at greater scale to more patients. For more information, please visit www.allogene.com and follow @AllogeneTx on Twitter and LinkedIn.


Allogene is seeking an R Programmer Intern to join our Biometrics organization. The Intern will gain advanced technical skills during a full-time summer internship. This is an exceptional opportunity to gain experience in a successful clinical-stage biotech company. The primary goal of the internship project is to work on data science projects to build R based analysis and applications. As part of the project, we will develop interactive dashboards and visualizations based on statistical models you create.


This role is based remotely during summer break.


Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

  • Convert Clinical data from various formats such as SAS, Excel, CSV files into R data frames/Tibbles and perform data analysis.
  • Perform statistical analysis with clinical and translational data and create visualizations and reports.
  • Collaborate with Statistical programming and Data Management to create reports such as EDC listings, Patient profiles and other reports as needed.
  • Create interactive dashboards including interactive safety tables, listings and graphs using basic R packages, R Shiny etc. and publish these reports into Allogene R environment.

position: SAP Ariba iXp Intern - Full Stack Developer
description:
Requisition ID: 276489
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program:


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:

1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team:
The Supply Chain Collaboration team is one of the fastest growing teams within the SAP Business Network, the largest business-to-business network in the world with over 3.6 million connected companies in over 190 countries. Our solution enables customers to manage and run an efficient supply chain and helps them collaborate with direct materials suppliers through innovative planning and execution processes. We are looking for bright engineers who are passionate about solving complex business problems with purposeful and beautiful software and have fun while doing it.


What you’ll do:

Position Title: SAP Ariba iXp Intern – Full Stack Developer
Location: Palo Alto, CA
Expected start date to end date: June 2021 – August 2021


In this role, you’ll:
  • Have the unique opportunity to work on innovation/prototyping projects that will enhance the Supply Chain Collaboration offering
  • Design and develop pixel-perfect UI, robust APIs, and scalable microservices for the cloud
  • Gain insight in how enterprise customers manage and run their supply chain on the SAP Business Network


Who you are:

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


  • Candidates must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent
  • Strong desire to revolutionize the enterprise application space by building beautiful and purposeful cloud solutions for business users
  • Strong programming skills in Java, JavaScript, SQL, CSS
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, ability to articulate technical challenges and solutions clearly
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
  • Preferred experience: familiarity with Angular, Microservices (Springboot), Kafka, JIRA, IntelliJ IDEA, JMeter, Jenkins, Github


WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations: Virtual - USA

As part of Lattice’s Applications engineering team, you will work with technical staff on projects to support customer solutions and work with our Marketing team to help develop reference designs and demonstrations. You will get a chance to work on our award winning Lattice SensAI tool to develop Machine learning and AI solutions targeted towards Lattice FPGAs. Intern assignments will provide broad exposure to Lattice’s unique and world-leading programmable products and an array of advanced software and hardware tools. Interns will experience life in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging, and exciting high-tech company.

Applications are welcome from all qualified candidates. In order to qualify, applicants must be currently enrolled in a degree program (Undergraduate or Graduate) and be legally authorized to work in the USA without sponsorship for employment visa status.

Accountabilities:

  • Assist with converting existing reference designs to our next generation FPGAs and software tools
  • FPGA application related firmware/driver development
  • Debug existing development boards using oscilloscopes and logic analyzers
  • Provide Technical support to customers while working closely with domain experts
  • Contribute to customer facing Technical documentation and presentation

Preferred Skills:

  • Strong understanding of electronic fundamentals.
  • FPGA design experience preferred
  • Board-level design and debug experience preferred
  • Experience in Verilog/VHDL and FPGA programming.
  • Preferred experience with scripting using Python, tcl or perl
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Help us grow into an ever-evolving marketplace. Seeking an eager Machine Learning Engineer Intern to help solve critical problems within our industry.

WHAT WE DO

Betterview is the only property data platform that informs every transaction for decision-makers who want to reduce risk, cost & waste in an increasingly competitive environment. We provide software and services that capture, organize, and analyze data for buildings and properties to unlock valuable insight. Our company is quickly becoming essential to every transaction by making every property thoroughly understood.

Every day, our team is focused on the needs of our customers. We strive to earn their trust by providing valuable, accurate insight that is important to their businesses. We provide our customers with information that is not only useful to their business decisions but is easy to use. We combine high quality human interactions with sleek, intuitive design and are pioneers on the journey alongside our customers, who are transforming the way they do business with data-driven decision-making.

THE OPPORTUNITY
Betterview is opening up exciting three-to-six-month-long internship opportunities on its machine learning team. We are looking for eager and enthusiastic people who are as passionate about solving tough problems as we are. As an intern, you will be able to participate in all parts of our process, from training computer vision models on aerial imagery to building out our machine learning infrastructure. Some of the critical problems we're solving are:

  • How can we keep improving our image classification and semantic segmentation models?
  • What additional value can we add by integrating other sources of information?
  • How can we better create and work with existing building footprints from aerial imagery?
  • How can we tell how well a property will interact with the upcoming storm season?
  • How will the property handle a brush fire in the near area?
  • How can we better determine the age of a roof?
  • How can we be more efficient about labeling and curating our training data?
  • How can we increase the speed and efficiency of predictions?

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

  • Training computer vision models to analyze buildings and properties, identify aspects of interest to insurance companies. You will work with datasets created and curated by the data science team.
  • Participating in efforts to expand and improve the existing machine learning code base. This includes adding to our dataset generation, training, and evaluation pipelines.
  • Identifying areas where Betterview should branch out and implement new machine learning systems and techniques
  • Exploring new techniques in computer vision. Follow the latest trends in computer vision and apply cutting-edge research to our challenges.
  • Evaluating classifiers and work with the data science team to promote the best models
  • Building and improving our code base

WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO OUR COMPANY


  • Experience training deep learning models for computer vision tasks
  • Knowledge of machine learning fundamentals, such as linear algebra, calculus, statistics, statistical learning, and pattern recognition
  • Understanding of machine learning design principles (e.g. training and validation, regularization, boosting, etc.)
  • Coding skills and good knowledge of computer science fundamentals (algorithms, data structures, time complexity)
  • Experience with and interest in working in Python
  • Experience with modern deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow/Keras, PyTorch, or Jax
  • Experience with common data science tools, such as Jupyter Notebooks, numpy, pandas, scikit-learn
  • Interest in reading academic papers and trying to implement state-of-the-art experimental systems
  • Familiarity with modern deep learning architectures, such as ResNet, UNet, etc
  • Knowledge of imagery analysis techniques
  • Relevant degrees (especially advanced ones) are always a plus, but we know great machine learning engineers can come from all backgrounds.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of data query and data processing tools (i.e. SQL).
  • Experience working with relational database tools such as PostgreSQL.
  • Experience working with cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, and Azure).
  • Experience with version control systems such as git/GitHub.
  • Publications in relevant conferences, such as CVPR, NeurIPS, ICCV, ICML, ICLR.
  • Experience with building footprint registration.
  • Experience with aerial imagery.
  • Experience writing production code.

WHAT WE PROVIDE

  • Hourly pay
  • Paid sick leave
  • Three to six months of valuable industry experience
  • Typical work schedule is Monday – Friday (8:30am-5pm)

In addition to federal law requirements, Betterview complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Betterview will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.

position: Software Engineer - Developer Intern (Remote & Unpaid Summer 2021)
description:
Are you passionate about building systems and software that lasts and will make an impact? Do you relish in the satisfaction of solving challenging problems? Do you want to build complex systems from the ground up? If these questions resonate with you, you've come to the right place!

ThoughtSpot is disrupting the Business Intelligence world in a big way and to do so, we need and welcome ideas from many areas within computer science: information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design and more.

ThoughtSpot relational search appliance brings the ease of search to enterprise data analysis. It includes a new kind of search engine, tightly integrated with large-scale, in-memory computing. The result is a consumer-class user experience combined with enterprise-class scalability while maintaining enterprise data governance and manageability for IT. We are looking for highly motivated individuals who want to make a big impact in their work.

This position is an unpaid internship. College credit is available. Our internships provide real-world experience to undergraduate and graduate-level students. As an intern, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects that will empower you to learn, build, and grow.

What it takes to be a Software Engineer at ThoughtSpot:
Strong coding skills in modern languages such as C++/Javascript/Python

Strong problem solving skills, algorithmic thinking and a strong foundation in how systems work.

Very strong computer science fundamentals

Bachelor/Masters in Computer Science, PhD preferred

Experience in designing and developing scale-out, high-performance systems OR experience with database design OR experience in building search engines including areas such as search relevance, aggregation and indexing OR full stack/frontend development experience in building complex web/mobile applications is a plus.

12 weeks are required for the internship.

Education :
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related technical field with an expected graduation date no earlier than December 2020

About ThoughtSpot

At ThoughtSpot, we solve some of the hardest, most challenging problems in technology. The kind of problems we solve require diverse perspectives and the team-spirit to see those differences as opportunities rather than roadblocks. It's why diversity isn't a box to check; it's the heart of "Selfless Excellence," our core value we live every day. To make our dent in the universe, we seek employees with unique identities, backgrounds, and perspectives that want to build an inclusive, respectful company culture and truly challenge the status quo.

We support our employees with great benefits like 100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage for employees and dependents, equity in a late stage startup backed by top-tier VCs, conveniently located Sunnyvale office with onsite gym, company-provided catered lunch and dinner, and paid holidays and flexible paid time off.

ThoughtSpot's Search & AI-Driven analytics platform puts the power of a thousand analysts in every business person's hands. With ThoughtSpot's next-generation analytics platform, business people can use Google-like search to easily analyze complex, large-scale enterprise data and get trusted insights to questions they didn't know to ask, automatically - all with a single click. ThoughtSpot's customers include the world's largest companies, such as Amway, BT, Bed Bath and Beyond, Chevron Federal Credit Union, De Beers, JD Sports, PetCo, ServiceNow, and Scotiabank.

ThoughtSpot is helmed by CEO Sudheesh Nair after being co-founded in 2012 by Ajeet Singh and technical co-founders from Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Oracle. Backed by investors Lightspeed Venture Partners, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst Partners, Geodesic Capital and Capital One Growth Ventures, ThoughtSpot has raised over $550 million to date at a unicorn valuation. Join us in our mission of enabling analytics "human scale" by putting search and AI-driven analytics in the hands of 20 million users by 2020.

For more information please visit thoughtspot.com.

Software AG is looking for ambitious, energetic, and motivated students or recent graduates looking to apply what they’ve learned in Information Technology, business, sales, and or project management as a Business Value Engineering (BVE) intern in our Reston, VA or Denver, CO office.

The role will provide a unique and exciting opportunity to start a career in Enterprise Software supporting some of the most advanced and industry leading technologies in the world.

This internship will be a 3-6 month part-time opportunity to grow and master your key analytical, sales, & project management skills - helping the North American Presales organization at Software AG.

We have an open-minded culture and many exciting projects where you have the freedom to “be your best you”. You’ll have opportunities for international collaboration on top of a comprehensive training and development program that encourages professional growth. We are in an innovative market and offer future-proof products. Most importantly, an overall a pleasant team-oriented working atmosphere.

About Castlight
At Castlight, our mission is to empower people to make the best choices for their health and to help companies make the most of their health benefits. We offer a health benefits platform that engages employees to make better healthcare decisions and can guide them to the right program, care, and provider. The platform also enables benefit leaders to communicate and measure their programs while driving employee engagement with targeted, relevant communications.
To date, Castlight has partnered with more than 240 large enterprise customers, spanning millions of lives, to improve healthcare outcomes, lower costs, and increase benefits satisfaction.

Description
Castlight Health is seeking a Software Engineering Intern to join our Web Applications team based in San Francisco, CA.

Castlight wants to help users navigate the world of healthcare and sickcare. That is to say, we want to motivate healthy habits - and reward people - in $$ for living healthfully. And we want to help users when they are sick - finding the right medical provider, service or company program that is best for them. For example, I am now earning reward points (that convert to cash) for tracking my daily workout, my sleep, and what I eat. And, on the other side of the equation, if you need an wrist X-ray for that carpal tunnel from either too much coding, or more likely too much texting – and then choose the best doctor for you. Whether that choice is based on quality, price, distance or all three – Castlight has you covered. Quick tip – go to an imaging center, not a hospital – our research shows you will save money and they all use the same equipment. Sure, Castlight provides much more like personalized recommendations, understandable summaries of your company’s benefit programs, a history of all your claims, and current HSA/HRA balances – and how much to go before your care is free for the rest of the year.

Our summer interns are an integral part of our team. You will work on real projects on our production system as part of our standard scrum teams. Thus, the specific work will vary by scrum team, but all interns will have the opportunity to write and test software in a web application framework, while partnering with a group of experienced software engineers who help and challenge them as they work on projects that matter to our customers. Collaborating with other developers and designers, the Web Applications team delivers innovative, engaging products that empower users to make the best choices for their health.

Qualifications
  • Pursuing a Bachelor's in Computer Science or a related field
  • Proficiency in Java and Angular
  • Experience with Ruby on Rails
  • Experience with CSS/HTML and/or MySQL (yup, we are full stack people here)
  • Computer Science fundamentals in any of the following: object-oriented design, data structure, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
  • Demonstrated ability to work well as a member of a software team
  • Passion for learning

We are Castlight and we are…

ONE TEAM

  • Changing healthcare is a team sport
  • Teamwork requires respect
  • Direct feedback is a gift that improves us
  • Diversity makes us stronger
  • We take care of ourselves and each other=

ON A MISSION

  • We put our mission first
  • We are here to transform healthcare
  • We tackle complex problems with curiosity, passion, and ambition
  • We bring our best every day
  • We learn and grow together

MAKING THINGS HAPPEN

  • Done well is better than perfect
  • We move fast to accelerate execution and learning
  • We are empowered to take action
  • We own the outcome
  • We win together

In addition, Castlight Health will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

We have several opportunities open for full stack development work.

We are a creator content platform focusing on AR/VR projects based in Southern California, seeking a unpaid part-time intern as our Full Stack Developer Lead to help with the following projects:

  • Re-design of a website and community network as well as accompanying app using Buddy Boss and Elementor.
  • Build our own custom dashboard on AWS / S3 with various API connections -- but this is a project that will take a bit longer that's happening in tandem.
  • We service an indie label client looking to build their own custom dashboard for 1) collection of big data (both qualitative and quantitative) from third-party sources, 2) communications between various permission based levels, 3) asset management, and 4) project management.

Please be aware as a self-funded / bootstrapped startup, we do not have any developers on staff currently -- so we are looking for someone to be proactive and really take a lead. We have considered hiring a few people so that there is support in troubleshooting and executing tasks.

As mentioned, this is an UNPAID internship so please do not apply if you're seeking a paid opportunity.

Our internships are offered online and for-credit / experience only -- and there are two options:

  • Candidates may be enrolled in a college or university, and if offered an internship, students must provide a letter from their college or university confirming that they will receive school credit. The minimum time commitment is 6 to 10 hours per week over 2 to 3 days per week.
  • Candidates are also invited to apply as industry professionals (whether recent grads or experienced developers) looking to volunteer time and effort as a cool side-project, career pivot, or simply to gain experience.

If you take this internship, you will work closely with both the founder as well as those in marketing and product/services management to define and develop streamlined workflows that will allow the company to efficiently apply, augment, and enhance what we offer both internally & across the web.

We integrate our interns as members of our Scrum/Agile teams where they participate in our weekly product / service planning meetings. We are looking for interns with experience in:

Build your career at Buildertrend, ranked #1 in Best Places to Work in Omaha 2019, 2020 & 2021!


Buildertrend is looking for a UX Research Intern who will help elevate the practice of research with creative but rigorous qualitative, quantitative, and/or design research methods.   • Generate insights that shape how product teams think about medium and long-term product strategy
  • Work cross-functionally with design, product, data science, content strategy, engineering, and marketing

  • Experience with autonomy and independent decision making to weigh tradeoffs and balance demands

Role Description: NuCurrent is looking for an Embedded Software Engineer Intern who is motivated to work closely with a talented and diverse engineering group to bring hardware and software together to deliver end customer products. Company Description: NuCurrent is a leading technology and IP company in the high growth field of wireless power and is the go-to provider of wireless power solutions for the world’s leading product companies. Spanning across industries including automotive, consumer, industrial, IoT, mobile, wearables and more, NuCurrent designs systems and key components for Fortune 500 companies and other industry leaders to enable wireless power transfer in new product releases. The Company supports product teams within large companies to bring wireless power innovations to market faster, with fewer risks, lower costs and better technology, while pushing the boundaries of system performance, charge speed, user flexibility and form factors. NuCurrent is a fabless technology company with a robust network of certified manufacturers and is an active leader in specification development across multiple industry standards bodies. NuCurrent has an energetic, purpose-driven work environment built by phenomenal people who go beyond expectations, are highly curious, deeply innovative and, above all, put customers first.

  • Python, Bash scripting experience
  • Linux experience

About us

Kyte is a technology platform that brings seamless delivery into the rental car experience. We are building the most compelling and customer-centric way to rent a car. With our value proposition of an easy car rental delivery experience with consistent & approachable support, we saw record growth throughout COVID19, and are now doubling down on gaining market share.

We recently raised more than $10M in venture funding from some of the best investors in the industry (amongst others: investors in Auto 1, Bird, Lime, DoorDash, Flexport, and Slack).

-

At Kyte, we love what we do and we believe our diverse team of ridiculously ambitious individuals is what makes our company great. Together, we are mobility enthusiasts that have an assortment of wide-ranging backgrounds from Stanford, Berkeley, MIT, TUM, Uber, BMW, McKinsey, and others.

We are headquartered in the sunny, San Francisco Marina district where we enjoy Bay views, good food, and a proper sound system for those late night working sessions. We have opened our second home strategically close to Oktoberfest in Munich, just 5 min from the Central Station in the beautiful district of Nymphenburg.

We offer competitive compensation, significant equity, and the ability to shape a big vision from early on. We are laser focused on bringing on talented individuals that are aligned with our value and mission, to create a magical rental car experience from end to end. You will have more than significant ownership and impact on our company trajectory, and shape how people get around the cities they live in. We look forward to hearing from you!

How we work

  • Our Backend is written with Python using Flask and PostgreSQL
  • Our Frontend is written with Typescript using React and React Native
  • We have the mindset "you built it, you run it"
  • We ship code to production (AWS) several times per day using Gitlab CI/CD


Requirements

    • Strong fundamentals in software development and computer science through a formal degree or bootcamp.
    • Programming experience and familiarity, from side projects or classwork, primarily in Python, Java, Go, Javascript, or any other similar language
    • Hustling-, hardworking- & shipping-products attitude: Go above and beyond to get things done!
    • Ownership: You are a self-starter and are satisfied by owning large chunks of the product roadmap.
    • Ambition: You are ridiculously ambitious and want to get the most out of your life.

Nice to have

    • Very good allrounder experience (Backend services, RESTful APIs, API design, server-side flow)
    • For frontend: Typescript using React and React Native
    • For backend: Python using Flask and PostgreSQL
    • Experience working in an agile setup using continuous deployment and delivery
    • Machine Learning experience (Tensorflow, Torch, Keras, ....)
    • Javascript / react experience
    • AWS deployments & DevOps
    • Data security and encryption mechanisms

Benefits

    • The opportunity to be a part of the exciting early stages of a well-funded, Silicon Valley based startup that has massive growth and venture potential
    • You’ll be able to work, innovate, and grow with a ridiculously ambitious, committed and fun team in the Munich and San Francisco tech ecosystem
    • You’ll have the ability to have major impact on a product that is on its way to impact millions of users in a profound way
    • Kyte benefits include significant equity, transportation benefits, gym benefits, office visits across between US and Europe and much more.

The Student Internship Program at Volvo Cars in Charleston is designed to introduce students to the fast paced, high tech, and ever-changing industry of automotive manufacturing. In this program students will receive direct hands on learning experiences and a deeper understanding of lean principles and lean manufacturing processes. We offer paid full-time work and a safe learning environment, for our interns to practice applying the knowledge gained in the classroom in a professional environment.

The factory in South Carolina is currently responsible for assembling the Volvo S60, mid-sized sedan. The American-built S60s are exported around the world through the Port of Charleston. Our plant employs nearly 1300 employees and sits on 1,600 acres of land in Ridgeville South Carolina, just a short drive from Charleston.

position: Intern - Network, Server, & Data Center Operations
description:
When it comes to making a meaningful difference in the lives of our customers and employees, USAble Life (a Life & Specialty Ventures Company) is always ready.

At USAble Life, we strive to have a positive impact in the lives of others, especially our employees. We are a diverse group of individuals working together to go the extra mile. USAble Life has made Arkansas Business Magazine’s list of “Best Places to Work” for an impressive fifth consecutive year in a row! This, coupled with our engaging culture and a comprehensive benefits package, ensures we are committed to our employees.

Life Takes You Places! Are you ready to join us?

A Network, Server, & Data Center Operations Intern will:

  • Work on a team that is accountable for the delivery of quality IT services and for analysis, installation, upgrade, configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting of software and hardware deployments in the following categories:

    • IT infrastructure (e.g. VMware ESXi, SAN storage, Windows & Linux servers, Azure & AWS cloud)
    • Network & network security (e.g. LAN, WAN, F5, VPN, firewalls, IPS)
    • IT systems (e.g. Active Directory, Exchange, SharePoint, Skype, Citrix, Secure FTP)

  • Or, equivalent military experience.

Preferred Education and Experience

  • IT related experience in a work study program
  • Two (2) or more years of school work until graduation

Becht is a 5 STAR rated Glassdoor, a Top 100 Best Places to Work in New Jersey according to NJBIZ and a Great Place to Work-Certified™ company!

Please attach a recent unofficial transcript with your resume. If you are a Master's degree student, please also upload your Bachelor's degree transcript. Failure to do so will create a delay in the review of your application.

Who is Becht?
Founded in 1964, Becht is a rapidly-growing, multi-discipline consulting firm relied on by customers to relentlessly solve their most difficult and entrenched problems. We combine vast experience through our network of over 1500 technical experts with both engineering expertise and professional experience. Becht is a company founded on excellence, and as such we seek individuals who want to be part of our passionate and energetic team.

Who Do We Want?
Becht is seeking junior, senior, master’s or doctorate computer science/software engineering students with interest in web app development with a database back end who want to learn more by joining our world-class, family-owned engineering organization. Becht is committed to developing young professionals by providing opportunities to explore the dynamic environment of engineering consulting services. Becht strives to provide the student with:
  • Real world experience with a consulting company operating with the latest technology
  • Guidance in the form of a highly trained mentor
  • A positive, team approach work environment
  • Hands on experience with the full SDLC during your internship

At Becht, our intern/co-op program gives students the opportunity to explore the practical applications of their college classes while working with customers from around the globe. We offer full-time student positions for every semester. These positions actively support current projects and are constantly evolving. As a student with Becht, you will learn to develop internal and client facing web apps, web pages, and productivity tools with a team of other software developers and engineers. You will be involved in the entire process from setting application requirements, creating data models, and designing the interface, developing the front and back ends, testing and assisting in deployment. You will be at the forefront of our most advanced and technically rewarding projects to assist clients in improving reliability and profitability while also reducing risks to people and the environment.

Build Your Career with Becht
A creative and innovative work environment isn’t all we have to offer! When you join Becht, you can expect:
  • A positive, collaborative workforce
  • Access to further training and development
  • Mentoring programs
  • Company and family events such as baseball games, go-karting, and bowling
  • Opportunities that provide stability as well as variety
  • Work day events such as birthday lunches
  • Community outreach programs such as Red Cross blood drives, Toys for Tots collections/volunteering, and United Way campaigns
Your Knowledge and Expertise
  • Passion for technology and can navigate across complex and rapidly changing landscapes
  • Detail oriented and organized
  • Creative and confident to express new ideas
  • Proven troubleshooting skills
  • Self-motivated and self-disciplined
  • Should be comfortable working in a virtual team
  • Ability to compartmentalize efforts—put one task down, pick up another, then resume the first with minimal ramp up required
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Object oriented programming experience
  • Database experience
  • MSSQL, Bootstrap, C# and/or .NET Core experience are a plus.
  • Must be enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent, degree
  • Must be available to work 40 hours per week for a minimum of one semester
  • Remote or must be local or willing to temporarily relocate to the Medina, OH; Liberty Corner, NJ; or Humble, Houston, TX areas or KC or MO; Northland area.

6 months Internship/Co-op blocks are preferred.

BECHT is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
